title: Variables in JavaScript

explanation.short: JavaScript has three main ways to declare variables: var, let, and const.
explanation.detailed: Modern JavaScript uses let and const for most variables. let is used for values that can change, const for values that should not be reassigned. var is the old way and has function scope and hoisting behavior that often leads to bugs, so it is generally avoided now.

best_practices: Prefer const by default, use let only when reassigning.
Keep variables as local as possible (limit scope).

common_mistakes.mistake: Using var and expecting block scope
common_mistakes.explanation: var is function-scoped, not block-scoped, which can leak variables.
const cannot be reassigned. Use let if the value will change.
